tweet: I was honored to speak at today’s #LeadersClimateSummit about the three things we need to do to avoid a climate disaster.  https://t.co/0YJJyabeIn

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Ambitious short-term goals like this are critical to moving closer to a net-zero future. As we rapidly scale the solutions we have, we must also invest in innovation to reach our ultimate goals. Thank you @POTUS for your leadership.  https://t.co/SVeKp1KPHT

name: Bill Gates
tweet: It’s encouraging to see @POTUS Biden and @ClimateEnvoy Kerry re-establish America’s leading role on climate change. I look forward to joining leaders from around the world to talk about some of the most important challenges we need to overcome to avoid a climate disaster.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Yesterday's verdict was a step in the right direction. But one court ruling alone will not bring to an end the injustice and inequity that Black people experience daily.  I hope we will continue to make real progress on this.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: “Time” is a poetic portrait of a family who love and support each other despite their difficult circumstances. I can’t recommend it highly enough.  https://t.co/pxkDEmL2SR

name: Bill Gates
tweet: If “Time” wins the Oscar this year, it will be the first documentary directed by a Black woman to do so. Garrett Bradley’s talent makes her worthy of that milestone. This is one of the most intimate movies I have ever seen. #itsTIME  https://t.co/37x1gfWZgZ

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Communities of color have been hit hard by COVID-19. One of the reasons why parts of the medical system often fail Black and brown people is because it’s not designed with them in mind. Dr. Stephaun Wallace wants to change that.  https://t.co/VIaM9385bv

name: Bill Gates
tweet: To get to net-zero emissions globally by 2050, leaders from around the world must work together. It’s encouraging to see governments, business leaders, and financial institutions committing to a successful COP26 in Glasgow later this year.  https://t.co/9bLQJvfZIR

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Dr. Stephaun Wallace (@imstephaunelite) has spent the last year helping make COVID-19 vaccines work for everybody. Stephaun and his colleagues at @FredHutch are working to reach the people who are usually left behind.  https://t.co/7wqSeT3DJN

name: Bill Gates
tweet: The amount of cement China has consumed is a staggering statistic and reminder of how much emissions have grown in low- and middle-income countries. (Minecraft concrete doesn’t count, though server farms are responsible for a lot of emissions.)  https://t.co/bFrIIUv97i

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Cement is responsible for 6% of carbon emissions globally. To get to net-zero by 2050, we need innovations to decarbonize the material. I discuss a few approaches to make low-emission cement in my climate book:  https://t.co/Ok1p3xQir4

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Who installed the most concrete?  Check your answer:  https://t.co/wqmmPffvwB

name: Bill Gates
tweet: The best way to prevent new variants from emerging is by stopping transmission of the virus altogether:  https://t.co/KhJoM3LBmr  https://t.co/5Vhfsjew3D

name: Bill Gates
tweet: It's encouraging to see innovation and clean energy investments at the forefront of @POTUS's #AmericanJobsPlan. Building markets for new energy technologies is good for jobs today and will build the economies we need while avoiding a climate disaster.  https://t.co/V6GcPSiaH8

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Here are five things you should know if you want to understand how variants are (and aren’t) complicating the pandemic.  https://t.co/rANiDcZynJ

name: Bill Gates
tweet: The technological transformation we need to address climate change can create good, safe jobs and build a more equitable, prosperous economy. To make that happen, we need to think big:  https://t.co/jFWTPyaOAq  https://t.co/PR5sxI7aDt

name: Bill Gates
tweet: It’s deeply unfair that the people who contribute the least to climate change will suffer the worst from its effects:  https://t.co/XciR3lIVzs  https://t.co/Y2do5GhsGx

name: Bill Gates
tweet: I named my book “How to Avoid a Climate Disaster,” not “How to Stop Climate Change,” because our climate is already changing—and no one will be hurt more by climate change than the world’s poorest people. Here's how we can help them adapt.  https://t.co/9mLJUpYErv

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Congratulations @AndrewSteerWRI on this important role. I’m excited to see what you and the Earth Fund will achieve. Avoiding a climate disaster is going to take all of us, and I’m grateful for @JeffBezos’s leadership and partnership.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Thank you @SalKhanAcademy for a great conversation about climate change and thanks to @BookPeople and @BlueWillowBooks for hosting the event.  https://t.co/mHQ2Adqkro

name: Bill Gates
tweet: For decades, Australian researcher Ruth Bishop led global efforts to identify and combat rotavirus. Her life is a reminder of the importance of scientific research to uncover unknown pathogens and the power of vaccines to prevent suffering and save lives.  https://t.co/X5okWwpBbX

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Virologist Ruth Bishop pioneered the research that led to the discovery of rotavirus. Her legacy continues both as a role model for other researchers and in the millions of children’s lives that have been saved because of her heroic work:  https://t.co/qjroJpzqTc #IWD2021  https://t.co/rEtrmXwFxJ

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Thank you @BarackObama for the kind words. Your leadership at the 2015 Paris climate conference helped prove that global cooperation on climate is possible and gives me hope that we can reach our goal of zero emissions.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: @EDFaction @Breakthrough Thank you for your partnership, @EDFAction, and for sharing what all of us can do to avoid a climate disaster.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Moving to a green economy is the biggest challenge the world has ever faced. I’m optimistic we can do it, but need to make sure it benefits everyone—including those workers and communities who depend on the fossil fuels that we need to get rid of.  https://t.co/UsjyfdOuQi

name: Bill Gates
tweet: We can’t avoid a climate disaster without corporate leaders making courageous decisions now. I hope to work with @VWGroup on building the markets for the clean technologies the world needs. Thank you for the kind words, Herbert.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Delivering vaccines to those who need them most, no matter where they live or how much money they have, is the only way to end the pandemic and begin the recovery. This is an important milestone.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: @EU_H2020 @EIB @Breakthrough @BloomBiorenewa1 To get to net zero, we need innovation to replace fossil fuels in everyday products like plastics. @BloomBiorenewa1 is one of the many companies leading on this important work.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: We're fortunate to have an Energy Secretary who's focused on creating high-quality jobs to build a clean energy economy. I look forward to working with @SecGranholm on clean tech innovation and deployment.  https://t.co/xFmM5zEIGp

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Recent extreme weather events are a stark reminder that we’re already seeing the effects of climate change here at home and around the world. This type of observation system will help scientists monitor and predict future weather events.  https://t.co/eO4eKSDRn0

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Thanks @kwelkernbc and @JCCAtlanta for a great conversation about how we can avoid a climate disaster.  https://t.co/MJRhbtDCzy

name: Bill Gates
tweet: I’m looking forward to joining @andrewrsorkin to talk about climate change, our foundation’s work in response to the pandemic, and more.

name: Bill Gates

tweet: Thanks to @andersoncooper, @SeaArtsLectures, and everyone who joined our virtual conversation about climate change. Great to have so much support from my hometown for this important work.  https://t.co/F2FB6GUIAj

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Great to see this important step as the United States resumes our global leadership on climate change. Looking forward to working with @POTUS and Congress on a plan to ensure we reach net zero by 2050.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Thanks to @streickercenter for hosting the launch of my virtual book tour. It was great to hear so many thoughtful questions about what we can all do to help avoid a climate disaster.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: When I talk to people about climate change, I almost always get asked the same question: What can I do to help? Here are some actions individuals can take to move us closer to a zero-carbon future:  https://t.co/ALBni7g2IP

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Thanks for inviting me on the podcast, @karaswisher.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Thank you, @AlokSharma_RDG. We have a lot of work ahead of us to reach net-zero emissions by 2050 and avoid a climate disaster. Your leadership of #COP26 is critical. Thanks also to @howtoacademy, @penguinlive and @Waterstones for hosting the London stop of my virtual book tour!

name: Bill Gates
tweet: It was great to talk with @alroker about my new book and the solutions we need to fight climate change.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: @CBSEveningNews @NorahODonnell Thank you @NorahODonnell for inviting me to talk about climate change. Solving it won’t be easy, but I believe we can do it.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Thanks for another great conversation @Trevornoah!

name: Bill Gates
tweet: I wrote How to Avoid a Climate Disaster because I see not just the problem of climate change; I also see an opportunity to solve it. Here’s how:  https://t.co/3X4ihy9hMf  https://t.co/QoMRuQ1g9x

name: Bill Gates
tweet: @CliftonLeaf Thanks for inviting me to be a guest editor. We need every business leader and every industry to play a role in the fight against climate change.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: I had a great time working with @FortuneMagazine on this special digital issue about climate change. The entire business community has a role to play—and we need to start now.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: How to Avoid a Climate Disaster is available now. I hope you’ll check out the book, but more importantly, I hope you’ll do what you can to help keep the planet livable for generations to come:  https://t.co/08U8Bx43eo  https://t.co/MRl69gIx2o

name: Bill Gates
tweet: The world’s power to invent makes me hopeful about climate change. Breakthrough Energy supports the innovations that will lead the world to net-zero emissions.  https://t.co/yBb8HMKAmJ

name: Bill Gates
tweet: To avoid a climate disaster, we need to eliminate emissions from the ways we create electricity, grow food, make things, move around, and heat and cool our buildings. It won’t be easy, but I believe we can do it. This book is about what it will take.  https://t.co/xyzs0x6CwB

name: Bill Gates
tweet: I enjoyed spending time with @andersoncooper recently in Seattle. We talked about why I’m optimistic that the world can get to zero greenhouse gas emissions and avoid a climate disaster:  https://t.co/exodP9bavN  https://t.co/2t0VncI0pA

name: Bill Gates

name: Bill Gates
tweet: COVID-19 has cost lives, sickened millions, and thrust the global economy into a devastating recession. But hope is on the horizon:  https://t.co/clsscPwQUD  https://t.co/sNl4kT9bE3

name: Bill Gates
tweet: This has been a year unlike any other in our lifetimes. In our new Annual Letter, Melinda and I talk about how we can turn the hard-won lessons of the pandemic into a healthier, more equal future for all.  https://t.co/Zt42aWl86x

name: Bill Gates
tweet: Here are four other ways that America can advance its leadership on climate change this year and put the world on a path to zero emissions by 2050:  https://t.co/vxEjYjqAaD

name: Bill Gates
tweet: One of the benefits of being 65 is that I’m eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine. I got my first dose this week, and I feel great. Thank you to all of the scientists, trial participants, regulators, and frontline healthcare workers who got us to this point.  https://t.co/67SIfrG1Yd

name: Bill Gates
tweet: It’s great to see President Biden elevate science leadership to a cabinet-level position. Congratulations @eric_lander.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: And while COVID-19 will rightfully continue to dominate the agenda, the United States also has the opportunity to lead the world in avoiding a climate disaster. The President is taking a great first step by rejoining the Paris Climate Accord.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: The President’s commitment to reengage with the world gives me hope that the recovery will reach everyone, including communities of color in the U.S. and people in poor countries around the world.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: With Americans across the country working together, more people get a COVID-19 vaccine every day, bringing us closer to a time when life will look much more like normal. Until then, we can slow the spread of the virus and save lives by continuing to distance and wear masks.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: I look forward to working with President @JoeBiden and Vice President @KamalaHarris to tackle some of our toughest challenges like COVID-19 and climate change. This has been a troubling time in America, but I see promise in the months and years ahead.

name: Bill Gates
tweet: #MLKDay has long been a national day of service. As we celebrate the first without Congressman John Lewis, I'm thinking about his powerful call to remain hopeful about the future as we work to make our country—and our world—a better place.  https://t.co/RpmKvrzjPo

name: Bill Gates
tweet: It’s great to see India’s leadership in scientific innovation and vaccine manufacturing capability as the world works to end the COVID-19 pandemic @PMOIndia  https://t.co/Ds4f3tmrm3
